DomainNameConfiguration.description:
The ``DomainNameConfiguration`` property type specifies the configuration for an API's domain name.
 ``DomainNameConfiguration`` is a property of the [AWS::ApiGatewayV2::DomainName](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-resource-apigatewayv2-domainname.html) resource.

properties.name: CertificateArn
properties.description: An AWS-managed certificate that will be used by the edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name. AWS Certificate Manager is the only supported source.

type.description: An AWS-managed certificate that will be used by the edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name. AWS Certificate Manager is the only supported source.

properties.name: CertificateName
properties.description: The user-friendly name of the certificate that will be used by the edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name.

type.description: The user-friendly name of the certificate that will be used by the edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name.

properties.name: OwnershipVerificationCertificateArn
properties.description: The Amazon resource name (ARN) for the public certificate issued by ACMlong. This ARN is used to validate custom domain ownership. It's required only if you configure mutual TLS and use either an ACM-imported or a private CA certificate ARN as the regionalCertificateArn.

type.description: The Amazon resource name (ARN) for the public certificate issued by ACMlong. This ARN is used to validate custom domain ownership. It's required only if you configure mutual TLS and use either an ACM-imported or a private CA certificate ARN as the regionalCertificateArn.

properties.name: SecurityPolicy
properties.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) version of the security policy for this domain name. The valid values are ``TLS_1_0`` and ``TLS_1_2``.

type.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) version of the security policy for this domain name. The valid values are ``TLS_1_0`` and ``TLS_1_2``.

MutualTlsAuthentication.description: If specified, API Gateway performs two-way authentication between the client and the server. Clients must present a trusted certificate to access your API.

properties.name: TruststoreUri
properties.description: An Amazon S3 URL that specifies the truststore for mutual TLS authentication, for example, ``s3://bucket-name/key-name``. The truststore can contain certificates from public or private certificate authorities. To update the truststore, upload a new version to S3, and then update your custom domain name to use the new version. To update the truststore, you must have permissions to access the S3 object.

type.description: An Amazon S3 URL that specifies the truststore for mutual TLS authentication, for example, ``s3://bucket-name/key-name``. The truststore can contain certificates from public or private certificate authorities. To update the truststore, upload a new version to S3, and then update your custom domain name to use the new version. To update the truststore, you must have permissions to access the S3 object.

properties.name: TruststoreVersion
properties.description: The version of the S3 object that contains your truststore. To specify a version, you must have versioning enabled for the S3 bucket.

type.description: The version of the S3 object that contains your truststore. To specify a version, you must have versioning enabled for the S3 bucket.

resource.description:
The ``AWS::ApiGatewayV2::DomainName`` resource specifies a custom domain name for your API in Amazon API Gateway (API Gateway). 
 You can use a custom domain name to provide a URL that's more intuitive and easier to recall. For more information about using custom domain names, see [Set up Custom Domain Name for an API in API Gateway](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/how-to-custom-domains.html) in the *API Gateway Developer Guide*.

properties.name: DomainName
properties.description: The custom domain name for your API in Amazon API Gateway. Uppercase letters are not supported.

type.description: The custom domain name for your API in Amazon API Gateway. Uppercase letters are not supported.

properties.name: MutualTlsAuthentication
properties.description: The mutual TLS authentication configuration for a custom domain name.

type.description: The mutual TLS authentication configuration for a custom domain name.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: The collection of tags associated with a domain name.

type.description: The collection of tags associated with a domain name.

attributes.description:
The ``AWS::ApiGatewayV2::DomainName`` resource specifies a custom domain name for your API in Amazon API Gateway (API Gateway). 
 You can use a custom domain name to provide a URL that's more intuitive and easier to recall. For more information about using custom domain names, see [Set up Custom Domain Name for an API in API Gateway](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/how-to-custom-domains.html) in the *API Gateway Developer Guide*.

properties.name: RegionalDomainName
properties.description: The domain name associated with the regional endpoint for this custom domain name.

type.description: The domain name associated with the regional endpoint for this custom domain name.

properties.name: RegionalHostedZoneId
properties.description: The region-specific Amazon Route 53 Hosted Zone ID of the regional endpoint.

type.description: The region-specific Amazon Route 53 Hosted Zone ID of the regional endpoint.
